sheet6.c_bookDatabase.subtests

Class CommandLineArgumentsTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • test.InteractiveConsoleTest
      • sheet6.c_bookDatabase.subtests.BookDatabaseSubTest
        • sheet6.c_bookDatabase.subtests.CommandLineArgumentsTest

  • public class CommandLineArgumentsTest
extends BookDatabaseSubTest
    Asserts the program's checking of the command line arguments. The program should print error messages for bad formed command line arguments. Meanwhile, correct ones should be read in without printing anything. Note that the program's ability to actually parse the input file is asserted in InputFileParsingTest.
    Since:
    30.01.2015
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Joshua Gleitze

      • consoleMessage

        protected java.lang.String consoleMessage(java.lang.String[] commands,
                              java.lang.String[] commandLineArguments)
        Description copied from class: InteractiveConsoleTest
        The message that should be printed at the start of an error message. Override this method to print your own message.
        Overrides:
        consoleMessage in class BookDatabaseSubTest
        Parameters:
        commands - the commands that were run on the interactive console
        commandLineArguments - the command line arguments the console was called with
        Returns:
        a String representing the session

      • testWrongTolerance

        public void testWrongTolerance()
        Tests the program's behaviour for a wrong tolerance command line argument. Asserts that the program prints an error message for:
        • a tolerance that can not be parsed as a Double
        • a tolerance that can be parsed as a Double, but is not between 0 and 1

      • testBadFilePath

        public void testBadFilePath()
        Tests the program's behaviour for a bad file path argument. Asserts that the program prints an error message for:
        • a file path that does not point to a file

      • testWrongCommandLineArgumentNumber

        public void testWrongCommandLineArgumentNumber()
        Tests the program's behaviour for a wrong number of command line arguments. Asserts that the program prints an error message for:
        • a wrong amount of command line arguments.

      • testCorrectCommandLineArguments

        public void testCorrectCommandLineArguments()
        Starts program with two valid command line arguments Asserts that:
        • the program terminates
        • if System.exit(x) is called, x=0
        • no error message is printed
